title: Week 10 PrepXtra highlights and scores
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Week 10 PrepXtra highlights and scores Here are the Week 10 highlights from PrepXtra, which airs every Friday night at 11 p.m., on WBIR. Check out this story on WBIR.com: http://on.wbir.com/1LTx2L5 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Week 10 PrepXtra highlights and scores Katherine Donnelly, 1:02 a.m. EDT October 24, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Week 10 of the high school football season is a wrap and there is only week remaining before postseason play starts. Here are the highlights from PrepXtra, which airs every Friday night at 11 p.m., on WBIR. For an entire list of scores click here . 
Fulton 27, West 13 Highlights from Fulton's 27-13 victory over West. WBIR 
Even though there were no region implications for this game, the matchup between Fulton (8-1) and West (7-2) was one of the most highly anticipated ones in the area this week. Zach Harshey connected with DeMarcus Smith to make it 7-0 West. Then with the score tied 7-7, Chaton Mobley gets it done for Fulton on fourth down to give the Falcons the lead. The first half ended strangely. Fulton coach Rob Black thought there should have been more time on the clock and they eventually put on .02. West comes back out on the field, but Tyler Jones ends the half with an interception. The Falcons ended up running away with it 27-13. West ends the regular season next week with a region game at Gibbs. Fulton hosts region rival Central. 
Greenback 49, Harriman 28 Highlights from Greenback's 49-28 win over Harriman to become region champs. WBIR 
Greenback (7-2) traveled to Harriman (6-3) to take on the Blue Devils. The winner of this game snagged region champ and top seed. Harriman fed the ball the TJ Phipps, early and often. Harriman got to the red zone and handed the ball off to Phipps, but he was stopped on fourth down by Greenback's defense. The second quarter was rough for Harriman as they fumbled the ball on a snap, which led to Greenback's Hunter Willis passing the ball to Tylor Jones who took the ball all the way to the end zone for the score. Greenback scored four touchdowns in the first half, and continued on from there into the second half. Greenback is your region champ beating Harriman 49-28. Harriman hosts Jellico next week. Greenback hosts Sunbright. 
Hardin Valley 38, William Blount 6 Highlights from Hardin Valley's 38-6 homecoming win over William Blount. WBIR 
Hardin Valley (5-4) hosted William Blount (2-7) for the Hawks' homecoming tonight. The Hawks were leading 14-0 at the half. In the third quarter with the Hawks driving, Jordan Snipes got the ball, ran down the sideline, but stepped out of bounds at the ten. On the next play, Issaih Aguero found the whole into the end zone and made it 21-0 Hawks. William Blount did eventually get on the board with Austin Myrick's touchdown pass to Isaiah Hannah, but Hardin Valley won 38-6. Hardin Valley ends the regular season with a tough game against Maryville, and William Blount plays at Bradley Central. 
Oak Ridge 62, Webb 6 Highlights from Oak Ridge's big 62-6 win over Webb. WBIR 
Webb (4-4) traveled to Oak Ridge (8-1) tonight for the first game these two teams have played in a while. In the first quarter it looked like the Wildcats were going to score, but the offense fumbled. The Spartans recovered, but were unable to get any points off the play. Later in the first, Jordan Dunbar decided to keep it and gave Oak Ridge its first score of the night. Then in the second, Dunbar connected with UT commit Tee Higgins. Higgins managed to get into the end zone even though close to eight Spartans defenders grabbed at him. Oak Ridge eventually ran away with it and won 62-6. Oak Ridge hosts region rival Campbell County for Week 11. Webb plays at region rival King's Academy. 
Unicoi County 42, Northview Academy 28 Highlights from Unicoi County's 42-28 win over Northview Academy. WBIR 
It's still hard to believe Northview Academy (5-4) is in its first year of varsity play.Tonight the Cougars hosted Unicoi County (5-4). In the second quarter, Unicoi County quarterback Hunter Hensley dropped back and found Michael Howell on the deep pass. The Blue Devils finished up that drive with a 14 yard touchdown score. The Blue Devils went up 42-14 after a two point conversion. Unicoi County grabbed the win tonight 42-14. If Northview had won they would have clenched a playoff berth, but next week they have another chance when they play region rival Elizabethton. Unicoi County plays at Johnson County. 
Seymour 48, Volunteer 28 Highlights from Seymour's 48-28 win over Volunteer. WBIR 
Seymour (7-2) has not clinched a playoff berth since 2009, but winning against Volunteer (2-7) tonight would get them there. Early in the first, Seymour quarterback Clayton Ogle handed off the ball to Jeremy Bryant for an Eagles TD. Seymour went up 6-0 after a missed extra point. Later in the first Ogle went off play-action and found Austin Brewster for the touchdown. Seymour tried for a 2-pt conversion and successfully went up 14-0. Seymour went on to win 48-28. Seymour faces Greeneville next week for the region title. Volunteer hosts region rival Sullivan South. 
Bearden 22, Science Hill 21 Highlights from Bearden's 22-21 overtime win over region rival Science Hill. WBIR 
Bearden (6-3) came off a big win against Dobyns-Bennett last week and faced another tri-cities foe in Science Hill (7-2) Friday night. Both teams were held scoreless after the first quarter. Science Hill put themselves in scoring position after a Bearden fumble and went up 7-0 after Justin Bedard takes the snap and finds the end zone. On Bearden's next drive, Cameron Jones bobbled the snap but quickly picked it up to find a wide open Ty Chandler for a big first down. Jones finds Ty Chandler in the corner of the end zone on the very next play to even the score at 7. This game was tied at 14 at the end of regulation. The Hilltoppers scored on the first play of overtime to go up 21-14. Bearden found the end zone on a third and 23 play to pull within one. Bulldogs elected to go for two on the two point conversion. Cameron Jones found Colten Tyler for the score, and Bearden seals this one up 22-21.Science Hill plays at Dobyns-Bennett to end out the season, while Bearden plays at Jefferson County. 
Catholic 45, Cloudland 23 Highlights from Catholic's 45-23 win over Cloudland. WBIR 
Catholic (5-4) clinched a playoff spot last week, and will enter the playoffs as a three seed. The Irish hosted Cloudland (6-4) tonight. The Irish were dangerous with the pass all game long. Amari Rodgers had a big catch for a touchdown tonight to give the Irish a 7-0 lead. Chase Kuerschen also had 56 yard reception up the sideline for a touchdown to make it 21-0. The Irish led 45-0 going into the half and finished the game 45-23. Catholic plays at Union County next week. Cloudland finished up regular season play tonight. 
Daniel Boone 38, Cocke County 12 Highlights from Daniel Boone's 38-12 victory over Cocke County. WBIR 
Cocke County (1-8) made the trek to Daniel Boone (1-8) tonight. The Trailblazers were up 24-6 at the half. Cocke County tried to come back in the second half, but they fumbled. Daniel Boone's Justin Clevenger recovered it and thought he got a touchdown, but the referees called him down. Daniel Boone's defense remained strong tonight, and helped the Trailblazers get their first win 38-12. Daniel Boone hosts David Crockett in Week 11, and Cocke County hosts Morristown East.
